website_summaries.verdict: This well-made pair provides excellent waterproof protection for those who need optimal lower-leg coverage.
pros: Suited for outdoor activities in wet conditions
Comes in several fun, colorful designs
cons: Fit too tightly around some wearers' calves
Knee-high length too long for some

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have done some major off-trail hiking while wearing these socks with smartwool socks under and breathable trail running shoes. My feet stay dry even if my shoes are soaked and water logged. I wasn't sure at first, so I decided to put on cotton socks under these socks and wear my tail running shoes into the shower. I then removed the shoes and stood in standing water in the shower. After, I removed these socks and my cotton socks were only a little moist, definitely not wet. I see how long their waterproofness lasts over time, and for how many wash cycles.
customer_reviews.author: CSH

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sock!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and warm. Does take longer to dry. Water soaked inside and out takes about six hours of direct sunlight with the sock being turned inside out every couple hours to fully dry. Same soaked sock a couple feet away from the fire draped over a stick took about five hours to dry. I’d be smart and get two so I always have a dry pair. Was very warm in the morning nip.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate sock test
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these for my stepson who's in US Army Infantry. He was about to head out on a week-long training exercize and had been told by others that the worst thing about it was the condition of their feet. We sent him these and he wore them for a week though swamps and mud and downpours, finishing up with a 12 mile run carrying 35 pounds. He told his dad that while most of the guys wre made miserable by their soaking wet boots and socks, his feet were FINE and it enabled him to sleep well at night; at the end of the exercis he finished the run first out of 60 guys.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Pyburn Craig

customer_reviews.title: They work very well and are still comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet dry while wading through swamps for Search and Rescue training here in Washington State :). Amazing!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF & UNRAVELING
customer_reviews.text: Worn only 3 or 4 times on a wilderness canoe trip. They did NOT keep my feet dry and to add insult to injury, they are unraveling (see picture). I would have returned these but didn't return from my trip in time. The return window was closed. For the high cost of $30, I am exceedingly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for kayak fishing. I wear them with a pair of cheap water shoes while launching. They are a bit thick, similar to a heavy pair of winter socks. Kept feet dry while wading in water at boat ramp. Feet did not get hot even in 90 degree weather. If feet do get hot, just put feet in water and the evaporative effect will keep your dogs cool!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews, I was expecting my feet to stay warm. Based on two outings, it seems that my feet stay dry. However, they feel damp. I use these for launching my kayak, and then wear them while kayaking, without shoes (I have a pedal kayak.) The outer layer is wet, so I think the sensation I’m feeling is that the air chills the outer lining, and so it seems as if my feet are damp - even though they’re not. All in all, I am happy with my purchase, but other reviewers talked about having “toasty” feet; not my experience; not cold, but a slight feeling of cool dampness.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works very well... Off-road riding.
customer_reviews.text: Been using these Randy Sun WP socks under my MX boots. This time of year in New England temps are cold and the trails are swamped.. Its a bad combination, touching down in water used to mean instantly froze feet, that I had to suffer with the rest of the ride. These socks do not let any water reach my skin and I don't feel wetness during the ride inside my boots anymore. They've made a world of difference. I have size 12w feet and am 6' tall. The size L socks fit just right and come up to just under my knee. The Randy Sun socks also have a nice lining, are very comfortable and do not fall down.
customer_reviews.author: PaiN

customer_reviews.title: My sister loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My sister camps a lot even in the winter. I bought the socks for her. She just went winter camping and here is her response: I love them. First it is super comfortable. You cannot feel the waterproof texture but it IS waterproof. She loves that it’s a knee hi so when she hikes water does not go up over the sock to the inside. She said it also protects her from bug bites. She recommends them and she is so happy I bought her three pairs for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah E. Small

customer_reviews.title: These are not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: As these are described and advertised as "waterproof" i tested them in the shower before wearing them for outside activities. When i removed the socks, after the shower, my feet were as wet as if i had not worn anything. The inside of the socks were soaking wet. If, like me, you are looking for truly "waterproof" then don't waste your money for these. Maybe, if you are just in damp conditions, they may be ok. They are comfortable. For me, i bought 2 pair, and spent a bunch of money, for something that will never do what i needed them to do. Too late for a refund. Very disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof under extreme circumstances
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 pairs of the knee high socks for my husband and myself for cycling in the rain. They are comfortable and warm for me. For my husband though, the socks don’t seem to keep his feet warm but he loves the socks same as I do. Kept his feet dry riding in the rain. I put mine to a real waterproof test- I rode through a 300’ long area of flooded road, 9” deep. My legs and top of feet stayed dry but the soles of my feet were soaked. So the picture of the feet running through a creek on the packaging got wet feet if the shoes filled with water, I would bet.
customer_reviews.author: outthere

customer_reviews.title: Do not keep your feet dry
customer_reviews.text: I just tried these out last weekend and they did not keep my feet dry. I road my dirt bike with regular dirt bike boots and it was raining all day. I walked through a couple of mud puddles around an inch above my ankle a few times. After 3 hours of riding I took off my boots and Randy sun socks to find my inner socks were wet. This was NOT sweat. I give them two stars because they kept my feet warm but NOT DRY.
customer_reviews.author: M Pro

customer_reviews.title: more like water resistant
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these. but after only the 2nd use of heavy water contact they did not keep my feet dry. dont get me wrong they are better than regular socks and are somewhat water RESISTANT but I would not call them water PROOF. I work at a truck wash so I am around water constantly for 8 hours and after about 3 hours into my second shift wearing them I started feeling the water come through. very disappointed since they were pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a rafting trip I was taking in Boise ID. I tried the socks before I took them. The bath tub test worked great ! My feet were dry. I could feel the cold but that could be resolved with other socks. I went on the first day of my trip anxious to do the true test. After about 3 hours I noticed that one sock was leaking. I was able to complete the trip with one dry sock. Needless to say I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Darr

customer_reviews.title: they work great
customer_reviews.text: i have a pair of medium height socks by them and loved them for winter hikes. they insulate really well on top of being submersible. ive gone through ice cold rushing water with them many times, your feet will get cold as your shoes fills with water and freezes over, but at least your feet are dry. I highly recommend the medium height over these unless you know you'll need the height. they are just more comfortable over all
customer_reviews.author: Scuba steve

customer_reviews.title: Use for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use as I switched from my dry suit to warmer weather kayaking. My feet don't get wet from the water, but they do sweat a lot. Might just switch to shoes no socks. Don't think the limitation is this company, just an overall issue with waterproof socks. In fairness, their use may be limited to the time between <60 water to water that is > 70 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: My husband recieved two pairs as a gift for Christmas, he loves them! He ordered two more. He wears them out fishing and out to the snow and says they do a great job in keeping his feet dry. He wears them over regular socks. They do not feel like your regular socks material, of course because they are made to be water proof so it has that rubbery material feel. All the while still comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: kazua

customer_reviews.title: Highly Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these socks for tournament fishing tough conditions. Rain, rough water, warm or cold I have wore them a few times now and love them. I usually wear rubber boots on the boat but feet sweat and normal socks become damp and uncomfortable. These randy sun socks worked excellent for me. I could actually step out of my rubber boots and walk around on a wet boat floor and at the end of the day my feet were dry and not pruned, not cold or uncomfortable due to wet feet. I have two pair of the knee high socks and am definitely going to order some ankle high randy sun's for my outdoor adventures when not on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney Gray

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof.... Save You Money
customer_reviews.text: The seller advertised that these neoprene water socks were completely waterproof. I bought 2 pair for $34 each, then I walked 40 mile in the Paria Slot Canyon in southern Utah, which has water running it. From the very first day of this 5 day backpacking hick my feet were wet and they stayed wet. My 30 day return date expired a few days ago, so I got it coming and going. Save your money this was a complete rip off.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: It works great.....to a point
customer_reviews.text: Got these to use for motocross racing (hare scrambles) as I know I'd end up in water. I ended up calf deep in the water. They did pretty well. Wasn't completely able to keep my feet dry- but certainly did better than regular socks. If you're just getting occasional water and not fully submerging in a boot. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GooseDad

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on top
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who wore it for skiing. The socks fit right except for the top was too tight that it was cutting his circulation. He end up switching socks after a couple hours because it was just too painful on the top portion. Too expensive of an investment that was just used for a couple hours and probably never again.
customer_reviews.author: ArleneD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect socks for outdoorsmen!
customer_reviews.text: I hunt! Through the mountain streams of East Tennessee and Western North Carolina, I track, run, and tree North American black bear. I also rabbit hunt in extremely swampy conditions. Even in these wet conditions, these amazing socks never fail to keep my feet not only warm but dry as well! I have recommended these socks to several of my hunting partners and they all love them just as much as I do!
customer_reviews.author: M. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: his sock size is rated to fit size 7 to 10. I wear a size 7.5 shoe, so you would think this is plenty big. No, barely fit. It is uncomfortable if I put another pair on. That is why I don't Chinese clothing any more on line, you cannot trust them and very difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: shiro showa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These work great for hunting in wet weather. If water makes it's way into boot, it stays outside sock
customer_reviews.author: Cy

customer_reviews.title: love em
customer_reviews.text: i coach and need to walk back and forth next to the pool; it's too much walking for sandals, i get blisters, non sandal shoes are not allowed, and the ground is too gross for barefoot. these are perfect
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks will definitely keep your feet warm and dry. I wear a pair of athletic socks as a base layer, and they are very comfortable. I am a mail carrier in Denver CO, and I definitely recommend these socks
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once, but I am impressed so far. I used these to launch my kayak. It's the end of October and my feet stayed warm and dry. These worked much better than neoprene socks/shoes as no moisture got in and they are substantially taller. After one use they are great, I will have to see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performed as described
customer_reviews.text: Walked the narrows in Zion National Park with these in October. Feet stayed warm even after water went over them and seeped in. Kept them dry until I left the shallows and went deep. Would recommend for any cold activity.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Foster

customer_reviews.title: Socks touted as waterproof are not !
customer_reviews.text: I wore these stockings for the first time today. They are supposed to be waterproof and are not ! Since I bought them 5 weeks ago they are no longer returnable. Does the manufacturer have a warranty so I can get my money back ($40 !!) ??
customer_reviews.author: LOUISE

customer_reviews.title: great socks
customer_reviews.text: recently I went fly fishing in Colorado with my brother-in-law who is a guide. I pulled on my neoprene hip waders and boots and he threw on his quick dry pants and water resistant socks. I thought my neoprene had sprung a leak but I was wrong, however, I have now invented a new tool to lose weight faster. I ordered these the next day. I tried them out putting ice in a cold bath. They kept my feet warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet dry snowshoeing
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I bought these. I bought them for doing the Narrows in Zion and didn't end up using them there. But I kept them for snowshoeing. Now my feet no longer get wet through my shoes like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and thick and keep my feet warm and dry when I go fishing. They come with a nice drawstring bag also. My only complaint is I had to get this color because all the other colors would not fit in an Amazon locker??? Seems really strange to me. Otherwise they are nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Great socks, even in icy Maine ocean!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great! I bought two heights for my son who is a sailor. Sailing in 50 degree water is not very pleasant and these have been fantastic. (He has a whole in the foot of his dry suit). His feet have been warm and dry even in icy waters. The taller socks are what he wears the most. Very wide feet and huge calves for a skinny teen. They fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Lussier

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'd almost wear these even if i didn't have to be hiking or going in water. They are extremely comfortable and great to be on all day.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Bought as gift for avid skier
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for a friend who likes to ski/snowboard. He stated they were very warm but didn't make his feat sweat.And he did not need to overlap these socks without socks to keep warm. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tried these out for the first time launching my inflatable boat from the shoreline. These fit to the top of my calves and kept my feet and lower legs dry and warm. I could feel the water temp through the socks while standing in the water,, but once on the boat my body heat warmed them up and could not feel the water at all. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Motor12

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky!
customer_reviews.text: They were warm and kept my feet dry (didn't fully submerge my feet though) on a cold canoe trip but there is no way I could wear them with shoes or hiking boots (women's size 6). I wore them with Chaco's that have adjustable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water proof socks
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my BF because he is very outdoorsy and sometimes finds himself in a situation where he has to wade through water. Sometimes it's refreshing, but when there's snow on the ground and below freezing temperatures, wading through a creek is torturous. These socks will keep his feet dry and warm so he doesn't get sick or hypothermia. I got him the knee length ones.
customer_reviews.author: Marie J.

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Socks were not waterproof but the quality of the making of the sock was sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Will K.

customer_reviews.title: Dry feet
customer_reviews.text: Used for off road riding in WA. To say it’s wet here is an understatement Rode through puddles and wet brush for hours. My feet were dry and warm👍
customer_reviews.author: Allen in Poulsbo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Wadding on beach nearly mid-calf in the surf in 40• water for hours three days in a row. My feet stayed dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Manual Laborer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and they worked! What more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.text: First pair of waterproof socks and was pleased. Took on a 6 mile hike through snow and mud and water, could certainly tell my shoes and socks were wet but my feet were dry when I took them off. They were comfortable and I didnt develop any blisters nor did I feel any type of seams or anything. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dry feet.
customer_reviews.text: I used these Sox on a dirt bike trip. Much of the time was spent riding through swampsThe boots were dripping wet and the feet stayed dry. Awesome Sox. Great for dirt biking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Walked into ankle high water with zero leaks. Super Comfortable considering its waterproof abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: good quality good company. little spendy
customer_reviews.text: Received very quickly. Socks are very comfortable and seem to be very good quality. Intend to use trout fishing this spring so have not actually used them yet. From what I can see for now I would purchase again. They are a bit spendy imo but if they keep my feet dry and warm its worth it. Will update after actual use.
customer_reviews.author: jay j

customer_reviews.title: Preliminary review
customer_reviews.text: stretchy and fit well, and stay up. mid-weight in thickness. definitely block wind. Have not gotten them wet yet. Add some warmth to my mountain bike shoes. Are they reversible? Wish they just sold black socks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Keep your feet dry!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for mountain biking in wet conditions. They are comfortable and keep my feet dry. Usually wear a size 10.5 shoe and the medium fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: P. Persic

customer_reviews.title: Warmth
customer_reviews.text: So great! I'm a mail carrier. What a difference these make. Took me 5 years to find!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia P.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely great socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for 2 years now and they are really well made and comfortable! they absolutely keep the water out without sweating! Just bought a pair for a friend, knowing they will like them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GGGGreat
customer_reviews.text: Fit nicely. I were and 8.5 and medium was perfect. Rode with these yesterday in below freezing weather. The wicked great feet never got cold of wet.
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Very comfortable and they did keep my feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: B. Larrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just be careful how you wash and dry them! Accidentally turned a pair of my husbands socks into mine....
customer_reviews.author: Spring K.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I like quality of material and you can reverse the sock. It’s not 100% waterproof but are comfortable and will keep your feet warm for a short period in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT in the stream
customer_reviews.text: Used these each day of a recent fly fishing trip to Montana. Could n't have asked for a more comfortable and water proof sock! Will be ordering another pair!
customer_reviews.author: HobbyBarbie

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: The socks fit great and have a nice feel to them. i have not had the opportunity to wear them in a wet situation yet so not sure of how they'll perform underwater?
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fillmer

customer_reviews.title: Pair I ordered are completely waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly what they're supposed to do. I tested them by turning both inside out and filling with water. No drips anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these everyday for the last 2 months and haven't had a issue yet. I work in a fish processing room with water everywhere. It's hard to find boots to keep your feet dry these socks solved the problem 100%. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Xandwmommy

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these socks in the Gila Wilderness in November. We trekked through the river for ~8 miles, doing 30-35 river crossings. My feet were bone dry at the end of the day. These socks are the BEST! Highly recommend. The knee-high length is an added bonus, no chance of water seeping in from the top. And they were quite comfortable too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and warmth
customer_reviews.text: Great thickness, plenty warm. My only complaint is that the inner liner has a seam that runs down the entire length of the center of my foot. Can't feel it when shoes are on, but can feel it if I do not haves shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I only wore the socks four or five times in very shallow water (deepest part was 8"). The last two times my foot was soaked, and I followed all directions of hand washing and hang drying. I would advise to find a neoprene sock or something like a fly fishing bib.
customer_reviews.author: jeff brown

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: These kept my feet warm and dry after 4 hours of snowboarding in below temps
customer_reviews.author: Tj.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, my feet are wet!
customer_reviews.text: Walked in ankle-deep water for a few minutes & felt dampness. After a few more I was definitely wet. Slow leaks in both feet in brand new socks. I have had success (non-leaking for several months of use) from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DrFriendly

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well. Feet were dry and warm after 4 hours or snowboarding in new Hampshire
customer_reviews.author: Tj.

customer_reviews.title: Great for skiing and cold weather sailing
customer_reviews.text: My son not only wears these skiing but also sailing in cold weather. They keep his feet warm and dry!
customer_reviews.author: Michele McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof sovks
customer_reviews.text: These are our second pair, needed higher sock to cross creek on daily walk. Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Cartier

customer_reviews.title: NOT 100% waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Hardly waterproof, crossed a cold stream and it soaked right through. The only redeeming factor is how warm they are when dry.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor R.

customer_reviews.title: They are waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these when I'm fishing. I can step into the water and release a fish and my feet stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because I broke my ankle and was put in and open toe walk boot cast they work great for warmth and water and wind for I'm from North Dakota and it's winter time good product easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: nobs

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for hard working men!
customer_reviews.text: My son works in an underground mine, and is always complaining about his wet & cold feet. These are the ONLY socks that have ever worked for him. He wears them every day, and has bought several pairs. WELL worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacki S

customer_reviews.title: Socks are great for leaky boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet warm and dry for 3 day camping trip wearing boots that are not waterproof. Boots were soaked inside for entire trip but socks are legit. Also kept my lower legs dry with wet pant legs. Love them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and seam to beholding up to repeated use and washing. The elastic top has not stretched out and holds the socks up even after several hours of hiking. I highly recommend these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for hikers
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit, will have to write back another time after a hike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: These really work well
customer_reviews.text: when you place your feet in water you fell like the water soaked through the the socks, but in reality it's the coldness of the water. Your feet are dry.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mutter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: waterproof tested in 5 gal bucket. Could feel cold water temp, but dry feet.
customer_reviews.author: James Nystrom

customer_reviews.title: Warm amd dry
customer_reviews.text: These kept my feet warm and dry in a day of skiing
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: worked amazingly in snow
customer_reviews.text: Took these to Canada and used in my hiking shoes while walking in deeps now. Feet stayed dry while hiking 6 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Kaminsky

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, use these for hiking in cold wet treks, comfortable and keep the toes dry and protected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they stayed dry
customer_reviews.text: so my feet were underwater and dry, can't beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: One of the best pieces of gear I own
customer_reviews.text: I wear these with sandles for stream crossings while hiking. My feet stay warm and dry 100%. One of the best pieces of gear I own. I bought 2 more pairs for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Chemical concerned shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for fall and winter kayaking and are working great
customer_reviews.author: e dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Great socks for rain and snow , definitely will buy another pair soon. Hard to put on cause of how snug they are , but it’s supposed to be , longer then I though but still like them.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really great product I use them to ride my dirt bike and I have to cross some creeks twice I put my feet in the water at one point the water went above my knees but the socks are well designed water didn’t go inside my feet I will definitely recommend this socks
customer_reviews.author: Jaime & Delmy

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet dry in my motocross boots riding in the woods. Just bought another pair
customer_reviews.author: richard marquard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They were a little tight getting on, but very comfortable all day long. Warm. I will be getting him more pairs... he works construction out in weather all day long..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry!!
customer_reviews.text: I used these sock for hunting. It was raining and I walked through several small creeks and my feet stayed completely dry. Great waterproof socks.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Very thick.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are thick. I am not able to wear my MX boots or snowboard boots with them. I’m sure they would work well if your footwear is a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Chad G.

customer_reviews.title: Water got inside.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my spartan race, water did get inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Marrero

customer_reviews.title: They work!!
customer_reviews.text: Love for rainy baseball games while coaching. Bulky but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bought to wade into water when cold for getting into kayak
customer_reviews.text: work great, kept feet dry and warm after wading into water while paddling in in kayak afterwards
customer_reviews.author: Jay U

customer_reviews.title: They worked!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but I wore these to this football game and my feet stayed dry. I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I did not like how they felt on my feet
customer_reviews.text: I did not like how they felt on my feet. Run wide and do not feel any compression which is what I like. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: June NEville

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the fact that my feet stayed dry. Ran a 50K and they felt great. The extra padding is a plus. Great in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Socks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these socks! But when I ordered an additional pair my package showed up with nothing inside! Who sends out an empty package?!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Lyman

customer_reviews.title: didn't work on the first ride
customer_reviews.text: These let water in but the water didn't flow out on my first use. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Socks are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Nothing !! Hiked Zion National Park. Forged Narrows. Waist high feet never got wet
customer_reviews.author: Joe Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great for those cold fall days ka yr aking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Socks Are Not Waterproof ir Water Resistant
customer_reviews.text: These socks aren’t water resistant or waterproof! My feet got soaking wet two days in a row. Don’t purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John  E Davis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely ecstatic about getting these socks.
customer_reviews.text: My son was thrilled to get these socks for Christmas. He is an outdoor photographer and does alot of hiking to get to some of his photo shots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: quality sock
customer_reviews.text: so far the fit and quality are perfect. will find out after motorcycle ride in europe
customer_reviews.author: Bosshoss

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely 100% waterproof!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks! I walk in creeks alot and these keep my feet 100% dry !
customer_reviews.author: doipuzzleyou

product_meta.title: RANDY SUN Waterproof Skiing Socks, [SGS Certified] Unisex Knee Length Breathable Hiking Trekking Sock 1 Pair
feature_bullets: Outer: 61% high waterproof nylon, 32% polyester, 7% elastane;Interlayer: a high performance lightweight function of waterproof and breathable membrane, Lining: 66% coolmax, 30% polyester,4% elastane

♥RANDY SUN is specially designed to the men, women, youth, boys and girls who seeks a sleek style and high quality products at a reasonable price. We devote to designed and developed in Waterproof,Windproof hiking trekking skiing golf outdoor sports shoes/socks/gloves/beanies, and NOT WATERPROOF BEACH shoes/socks. We take great pride in the quality of our products and the fact that it can be purchased at a price that makes everybody satisfied. RANDY SUN is not the cheapest,but it is the best!

COMFORTABLE These seamless, waterproof-breathable socks keep your feet dry and comfortable in wet conditions without adding bulk or sacrificing comfort – no plastic bag feeling like other waterproof socks.

FOUR SIZES: Extra Small Size - fit for US men 5-7 and US women 6-8; Small Size - fit for US men 7.5-9.5 and US women 8.5-11; Medium Size - fit for US men 10-12.5 and US women 11.5-13.5; Large Size - fit for US men 13-15 and US women 14-16. Please refer to images on the left for more detailed size information. NOTE: The Waterproof Socks with the Three-Layer Construction might be A Little Thick to stuff into certain shoes. Please match with Loose Fit shoes.

OCCASION：Daily Wear,foot care,especially suitable for outdoor sports and activities of various kind of harsh environments. Suitable for biking,walking and running during warmer seasons when there is a need to keep dry feet.

EASY CARE：Hand wash under normal temperature,water temperature should be below 40 degree centigrade if machine wash, do not iron, dry clean or tumble dry but hang to dry after spin-dry in ventilated place.

RANDY SUN is specially designed to the men and women who seeks a sleek style and high quality products at a reasonable price.We take great pride in the quality of our products and the fact that it can be purchased at a price that makes everybody satisfied.
